replies.author: aman1309

replies.bodyText:
The state is not for the entire PdlBuilder, but only when writeJson is called (ie at a function scope). After this function is completed, the state of _jsonBuilder is invalid. So using a member variable to set the state for a particular function is odd.
What if someone uses the _jsonCodec on some other code path without updating the prettyPrinter?
It is not explicit that pretty printer should be updated before the code should be used.
What happens if PdlBuilder stops using _jsonCodec in toJson?
It is not explict that PdlBuilder is expecting json to be formatted by custom builders.

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this method is necessary. You can avoid adding this logic as an overridden method which calls the super method (a little confusing) by just updating the codec's pretty printer on indent change (i.e. #increaseIndent and #decreaseIndent). It seems more intuitive IMO to compute the indent string and update the pretty printer on indent change rather than on each use.
timeline.author: evanw555

replies.bodyText:
It shouldn't be confusing at Indenter is kind of decorating the vanilla builder so it should be good to have child class calling super method.
Regarding having this logic in increase and decrease indent I would avoid it as to why build it when it's not needed.
